text:
after installing Apache 2.0.49 and try to start the server i get an error sayin

no installed service named "Apache2"


I tried to reinstall and redownload aswell.
creator: corey_gray4@hotmail.com
webmaster@ebinformatique.com
text:
(In reply to comment #0)
> after installing Apache 2.0.49 and try to start the server i get an error sayin
> 
> no installed service named "Apache2"
> 
> 
> I tried to reinstall and redownload aswell.

Same here, both with apache 2.x and 1.x.

Tried on XP Home and  XP Pro, both with SP2 it just not creates the service,
only solution i found out was to uninstall SP2, install apache and then
re-install SP2.

creator: eddiearmeen@yahoo.co.uk
text:
When you installed the msi file did you choose to install to all users or just 
to the current user?

If you installed to all users can you run the install and generate an msi log 
by doing:

msiexec /i apache_2.0.54-win32-x86-no_ssl.msi /L*v apacheMsiInstall.log

and attach the log to the bug?

Also is this xp pro sp 2?

creator: Dan@blueknot.com
text:
Same here... have tried installing for all users and just for current.  Have
also tried disabling Spybot S&D Resident and NAV.  No Joy.
2.0.54

creator: bastien_k@hotmail.com
text:
I found that using the default install of skype caused the problem for me. In 
skypes config it can be set to listen/use port 80/443 and this was giving 
apache the headache.

To solve it I opened skype's config and went to 
tools > options > connection  

and unchecked the box to use port 80/443...then it all worked

hth 

bastien

creator: tech-subscrip@charter.net
text:
I also forgot to mention, there are no errors in the error log.
This is because the service name is invalid, so Windows can't even attempt to
use it.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
In 2.2 httpd no longer insists on the sockets being configured correctly,
so 98% of such issues should be resolved.
